clinical_study.official_title: Hypo-hydration, Mood and Cognition: the Effect of the Colour and Type of Drink

brief_summary.textblock: Recently changes in mood and cognition have been reported following minor reductions in hydration status. The aim is to explore that such changes in part at least reflect placebo response; therefore the consumption of plain or coloured water will be compared in drinks designed to differ in their ability to rehydrate.

detailed_description.textblock: 162 individuals will be subject to a temperature of 30Â°C for three hours, and mood and cognition monitored. Randomly on two occasions they will consume no drink or 300ml of plain or red colored water. In addition they will take a capsule containing sodium chloride or a placebo. Mood will be monitored using visual analogue scales and a battery of cognitive tests will be completed on three occasions: attention, episodic and working memory, reactions times. Urine osmolality will be measured at the beginning and end of the study and changes in body mass will be recorded. Changes in functioning will be related to the nature of the drink and changes in osmolality and body mass.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: The study has six arms. Salt alone; salt plus water; salt plus colored water; placebo alone; placebo plus water; placebo plus colored water
study_design_info.masking_description: Salt / placebo will be consumed by capsule under a double-blind procedure

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline after 90 and 180 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: A list of 30 words will be presented after which the subject writes down as many as can be recalled. The resulting score will vary from 0-30.

secondary_outcome.measure: Serial Sevens; test of working memory
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline after 90 and 180 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: 28 numbers each of three digits will be presented and the subject indicates whether a subsequent number was exactly seven less. The measure reported is the response time in milli-seconds taken to respond

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline after 90 and 180 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: A series is presented that can be >>>>> or >><>> and the subject has to indicated whether the middle symbol points to the right or left. The measure reported is the time taken to respond in milli-seconds

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline after 90 and 180 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: The time to press a button under an illuminated light was recorded in milli-seconds when there was 1, 2, 4, or 8 possible lamps that could be lit. 20 trials were performed with each of the four number of lights.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- 18 to 30 years
- Non-smokers
- BMI < 30
- By self-report in good health
- Not taking medication for any psychological or other health disorder.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Do not meet inclusion criteria
